TITLE: North Korea says missile tests were practices to 'mercilessly' strike key South Korean and US targets
SUMMARY: North Korea's military claimed that their recent missile drills were practice to “mercilessly” attack South Korean and American targets, as the DPRK responds to recent air drills.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: "Cold" war in Kyiv as Russia hits country's energy infrastructure
SUMMARY: With winter upon them, Ukrainians are hunkering down as Putin's military has began targeting the country's energy suppliers. Fox News's Greg Palkot reports on the latest from Kyiv.

TITLE: Air Force insists penis-shaped flight path aimed at Russian base was not intentional
SUMMARY: Air Force pilots who drew what resembled a penis in the sky pointed at Russian forces in Syria did not do so intentionally, the Air Force said in a statement last week.

TITLE: 'Putin's chef' claims to have interfered in US elections: report
SUMMARY: An entrepreneur known as "Putin's chef" due to his catering contracts with the Kremlin admitted for the first time that he had interfered in U.S. elections and would continue to do so.

TITLE: World’s tallest woman takes first flight after airline makes big accommodations
SUMMARY: Rumeysa Gelgi, a Turkish woman who is ranked as the tallest living woman in the world, took her first flight after the airline removed six economy seats to accommodate her.

TITLE: Air Force insists penis-shaped flight path aimed at Russian base in Syria was not intentional
SUMMARY: Air Force pilots who drew what resembled a penis in the sky pointed at Russian forces in Syria did not do so intentionally, the Air Force said in a statement last week.

TITLE: North Korea is biding time before it conducts 7th nuclear test, experts say
SUMMARY: North Korea tested dozens of missiles last week but it is uncertain when its seventh nuclear test will take place. Some experts say Kim Jong Un is biding his time.

TITLE: US aid worker shot and killed in Baghdad, Iraq
SUMMARY: Gunmen shot and killed a U.S. citizen on Monday who was working as an aid worker for an international organization in Baghdad, Iraq, officials said.

TITLE: Residents clash with Chinese authorities over 'zero-COVID' rules
SUMMARY: As the Chinese Communist Party relentlessly pursues its strict "zero-COVID" policies across China seven people have been arrested amidst protests in retaliation.

TITLE: Discovery of bronzes rewrites Italy's Etruscan-Roman history
SUMMARY: The San Casciano dei Bagni archaeological dig near Siena on Tuesday discovered a 2,000-year-old bronze statue in an ancient Tuscan thermal spring, experts say it will "rewrite history".

TITLE: Ukraine's Zelenskyy urges 'unwavering' support if GOP takes House in midterms
SUMMARY: As Americans head to the polls, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged "unwavering" support for Kyiv even if GOP gain the majority in the House.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: A close-up look at the deadly and dangerous Iranian drones targeting Ukraine
SUMMARY: Fox News' senior foreign affairs correspondent, Greg Palkot reports on the deceptively innocent-looking Iranian drones raining death and destruction down on Ukraine.

TITLE: White House should call for regime change in Iran and take sanctions relief off the table, report says
SUMMARY: Iran expert Tzvi Kahn says the Biden administration should take the possibility of sanctions relief for Iran off the table and explicitly call for regime change in the country.

TITLE: North Korea launched ballistic missile toward eastern sea, South says
SUMMARY: South Korea said North Korea has launched at least one missile toward its eastern sea. The South did not indicate how far the missile had flown.

TITLE: Actor Sean Penn gives his Oscar to Zelenskyy to keep until Ukraine 'wins' war against Russia
SUMMARY: Sean Penn, a Hollywood actor and director, gave Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelenskyy one of his Oscar awards on Tuesday. Penn has won two Oscars for Best Actor.

TITLE: 3 American tourists found dead in Mexico City Airbnb likely killed by carbon monoxide poisoning
SUMMARY: Three American tourists in Mexico who traveled to the country to celebrate Day of the Dead were found dead in their Airbnb rental due to an apparent carbon monoxide leak.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook : Old-style gear to fight current-day Ukraine war
SUMMARY: With winter fast approaching, Ukraine's former president is helping to supply the troops on the front line of the war against Russia with much-needed generators and heaters.

TITLE: German authorities free girl, 8, held captive for 7 years by mother, grandparents
SUMMARY: A German girl's mother and grandparents allegedly held the 8-year-old captive in their family home for seven years. Police say the mother apparently faked a move to Italy.

TITLE: Qatar World Cup ambassador's interview cut off after he says homosexuality is 'damage in the mind'
SUMMARY: A World Cup official in Qatar drew criticism after stating that homosexuality is "damage in the mind' and said visitors to his country will have to "accept" the rules.

TITLE: American woman released from Saudi Arabian jail after two-day detention over tweets critical of the kingdom
SUMMARY: Carly Morris has remained trapped in Saudi Arabia since 2019 when she took her daughter to visit her ex-husband's family as the country's guardianship laws favor the father.

TITLE: Ukraine getting 90 refurbished T-72B tanks from US, the Netherlands, and Czech Republic
SUMMARY: Ukraine's military is getting 90 refurbished T-72B main battle tanks under a deal struck by the United States, the Netherlands, and the Czech Republic.

TITLE: Paris Metro workers strike for wage hike, disrupt commutes
SUMMARY: Some Paris Metro lines were shut down in light of a nationwide day of walkouts and protests by teachers, train drivers, and other public sector workers demanding more pay

TITLE: Iran protests rage on streets as officials renew threats
SUMMARY: Protests on the streets of Iran prompted the Iranian government to threaten protesters and demonstrators, calling them "flies," and sparking confrontations.

TITLE: Putin to add military training to school lessons, Education Ministry insists lessons are 'extra-curricular'
SUMMARY: The Ministry of Defense first announced the new module, but the Ministry of Education quickly clarified that the module would not serve as part of regular curriculum.

TITLE: Iran claims to have built hypersonic ballistic missile
SUMMARY: Iran's Revolutionary Guard claims it has developed a hypersonic ballistic missile as tensions with West remain heightened.

TITLE: Senior nurse had 'sleepless nights' after incidents involving alleged baby killer Lucy Letby, jury told
SUMMARY: A UK Court hears how one baby - the third allegedly murdered by nurse Lucy Letby over a two-week period - suffered three collapses during one night

TITLE: Putin to skip Indonesia G20 summit due to assassination fear: Report
SUMMARY: Vladimir Putin will not be attending next week's G20 summit in Bali, Indonesia which one of his advisers said could be due fear of an assassination attempt.

TITLE: 'Plastic Man' has a mission: Cleaning up Senegal
SUMMARY: A man dressed in the plastic trash he collects is trying to raise awareness about the dangers of plastics in Senegal by founding an environmental association, called Clean Senegal.

TITLE: Russia flew stolen Western cash and weapons to Iran: Report
SUMMARY: Russia flew over $140 million of stolen Western cash and munitions that were bound to assist the Ukrainian military to Iran as payment for suicide drones used in Ukraine.

TITLE: Taliban to ban women from gyms, parks because gender segregation, headscarf laws 'not observed'
SUMMARY: The Taliban instituted the ban after attempting several policies to enforce a gender segregation, including different days for men and women to access parks and gyms.

TITLE: With Russia's retreat from Kherson, Russia and Ukraine have an opportunity to negotiate peace
SUMMARY: U.S. Army Gen. Mark Miley believes now that Russia is retreating from Kherson, it is a good time to negotiate peace between Russia and Ukraine.

TITLE: EU commission president announces $250 million support package for Moldova to offset energy crisis
SUMMARY: Moldova, a border country to Ukraine, is receiving a $250 million support package from the European Union to help with the winter energy crisis caused by Russia's war with Ukraine.

TITLE: Iran-linked militia group claims responsibility for murder of American aid worker in Iraq
SUMMARY: Tennessee native Stephen Troell was killed in Iraq on Monday. The Iranian-backed militia group Saraya Ahl al’Khaf has claimed responsibility for the murder.

TITLE: Syria's lack of medical care and poor water quality exacerbates cholera outbreak
SUMMARY: Syria's poor water supply and lack of medical care exacerbates the cholera outbreak across the country's provinces. Syria’s cases are linked to a outbreak that began in Afghanistan.

TITLE: Newly discovered Egyptian tunnel could be link to Cleopatra's long-lost tomb
SUMMARY: Speculation has arisen that a newly discovered tunnel near Alexandria, Egypt, could potentially lead to the long-lost 2,000-year-old tomb of Queen Cleopatra.

TITLE: Egyptian prison authorities intervene medically after imprisoned activist escalates hunger strike
SUMMARY: Alaa Abdel-Fattah, a pro-democracy activist, escalated his hunger strike by not drinking any water. Egypt authorities now say he is now receiving medical intervention.

TITLE: US sending Ukraine another $400 million weapons package, bringing total to over $19 billion
SUMMARY: The Biden administration announced another $400 million weapons package for Ukraine on Thursday as Russia ramps up attacks on critical infrastructure.

TITLE: Belgium stabbing suspect was on list of potential extremists
SUMMARY: A suspect identified as Yassine M allegedly stabbed and killed one Belgian police officer and wounded another, he had previously been on counterterrorism lists of political extremists

TITLE: In Sweden, 2 Iranian brothers charged with spying for Russia
SUMMARY: In Sweden, two Iranian brothers were charged with allegedly spying for Russia for around a decade. They had access to information that could damage Sweden's security, officials said.

TITLE: Belgium officer killed, 1 injured in suspected terrorism attack
SUMMARY: A Belgium police officer was killed and another injured in a stabbing on Thursday that was suspected to be linked to terrorism. The phrase “Allahu akbar” was shouted during the attack.

TITLE: Vatican auditor files $9.5M lawsuit for wrongful dismissal
SUMMARY: The Vatican’s first auditor general and his deputy have filled a lawsuit against the Holy See for $9.5 million on account of wrongful dismissal by forcing them to resign in 2017.

TITLE: China arrests 9 coronavirus lockdown enforcers after video shows them beating civilians
SUMMARY: Police in China have arrested nine coronavirus lockdown workers for allegedly beating civilians in an incident that was captured on video and posted to social media.

TITLE: African countries seek funding to tackle climate change
SUMMARY: African nations are seeking funding at the U.N. climate summit to adapt to climate change. The funds will be used to provide solutions to millions of people in the continent.

TITLE: Seoul court approves extradition of suspected 'suitcase murderer'
SUMMARY: The Seoul High Court has approved the extradition of a suspect charged with murder in New Zealand. The suspect is possibly connected to two dead children found in a suitcase.

TITLE: UN General Assembly adopts resolution accusing Taliban of human rights violations in Afghanistan
SUMMARY: The Taliban has been accused of violating the human rights of women and girls in Afghanistan. The U.N. General Assembly has adopted a resolution regarding the issue.

TITLE: Protests and strikes erupt across Europe as soaring inflation, cost of living drives 'winter of discontent'
SUMMARY: Workers all across Europe are taking to the streets in demonstrations and strikes that at times have become violent as citizens protest soaring inflation and cost of living hikes.

TITLE: Vatican announces sexual abuse investigation into prominent French Cardinal Jean-Pierre Ricard
SUMMARY: The Vatican is opening an investigation into French Cardinal Jean-Pierre Ricard for alleged sexual abuse. Ricard allegedly kissed a 14-year-old girl decades ago.

TITLE: Ukraine's Zelenskyy says Kherson 'ours' after Russian retreat
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenksyy championed another victory by his forces and said Kherson was 'ours' after Russian forces withdrew Friday.

TITLE: UN to launch new platform to track methane emitters from space
SUMMARY: The UN is seeking out methane emitters with new data from space. This new system is intended to help companies act on major emissions sources and provide data in a transparent way.

TITLE: Calls grow for boycott of Qatar World Cup amid human rights violation concerns
SUMMARY: Supporters of the effort to boycott the World Cup in Qatar this month — in response to human rights abuses in the the country — say the movement is growing traction.

TITLE: Chinese residents celebrate decrease in COVID restrictions
SUMMARY: China has shortened COVID-19 restrictions Friday for time spent in quarantine for those exposed to the virus by two days.

TITLE: Germany fears winter COVID wave as restrictions ease
SUMMARY: German health authorities are anticipating a winter surge in COVID cases. This comes as Bavaria, Baden-Wuerttemberg, Hesse and Schleswig-Holstein plan to ease quarantine guidelines.

TITLE: Paul Pelosi, Biden family members among 200 Americans sanctioned by Russia
SUMMARY: Russia said on Friday it has banned 200 Americans, including Paul Pelosi, from entering the country because of their support for Ukraine.

TITLE: Underwater earthquake struck near Tonga in southern Pacific
SUMMARY: An underwater earthquake has made itself aware near Tonga in the southern Pacific. Authorities issued, then soon lifted, a tsunami advisory.

TITLE: Mexico shooting leaves 9 dead in gang-riddled area: 'Get the f--k out of here'
SUMMARY: Mexican police say that a gang-related shooting left nine people dead and another two injured on Wednesday night, and the gang left behind a letter reading "Get the f–k out of here."

TITLE: Egypt taking steps to increase renewable energy despite challenges
SUMMARY: Egypt is taking steps to increase renewable energy generated in the country, but a new string of gas discoveries may slow the country's transition.

TITLE: Russian cybercriminals accused of hacking Australia's largest health insurer
SUMMARY: Russian cybercriminals are being accused of stealing the personal information of Australian health insurance customers. Police say 9.7 million people had their personal data stolen.

TITLE: Russia's ambassador to Japan blames crumbling relationship on Japan
SUMMARY: The Russian ambassador to Japan has placed blame on Tokyo for Japan and Russia's weakening relations, specifically the sanctions the Asian nation has leveraged against Russia.

TITLE: US rejects over 1,000 Chinese solar energy component shipments over slave labor concerns
SUMMARY: Over 1,000 solar energy component shipments from China's Xinjiang region have been abandoned following an import ban as concerns mount over slave labor and the detention of Uyghurs.

TITLE: Footage of Philadelphia used in Mexican anti-drug PSAs
SUMMARY: The Mexican government has begun releasing anti-drug PSAs featuring footage of homelessness and public drug use in Philadelphia's Kensington neighborhood.

TITLE: Spain's coalition government proposes to reform sedition penalty
SUMMARY: Spain's coalition government has presented a proposal to reform the crime of sedition to be replaced with crime of aggravated public disorder and carry lower sentences.

TITLE: Climate activists fail to glue themselves to 'The Scream' painting in Norway: 'I scream for people dying'
SUMMARY: Norwegian climate activists with the group Stop Oil Exploration attempted to glue themselves to Edvard Munch’s 1893 “The Scream” painting on Friday.

TITLE: China's low birth rate being hit by sky rocketing costs associated with weddings
SUMMARY: Chinese communist party officials are concerned about the high costs associated with getting married. Authorities are worried that any drop in the wedding rate will further damage the country's falling birth rates.

TITLE: Ukrainian lawmaker reminds GOP of WWII lessons, no 'national security' without 'international stability'
SUMMARY: A Ukrainian lawmaker urged Congress to remember the lessons learned from World War II and continue unifying support for Kyiv no matter which party takes majority control.

TITLE: Netanyahu warns a 'pernicious' form of antisemitism more popular today
SUMMARY: Benjamin Netanyahu's return to power following a closely fought contest in November's election occurs at a time when antisemitism has grabbed headlines.

TITLE: Russia orders more hypersonic missiles as Ukrainian brass warns of possible attack during G20 summit
SUMMARY: Moscow has ordered 'several dozen' more hypersonic missiles this fall to boost its dwindling stocks as the war in Ukraine continues.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: A brief feel of 'victory' in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Fox News' senior foreign affairs correspondent Greg Palkot reports on what is being called an 'historic' moment by President Zelenskyy following the entrance of Ukrainian troops to Kherson.

TITLE: US calls for Ukraine to liberate all its citizens, as chances of peace talks diminish
SUMMARY: Top U.S. official Saturday called on Ukraine to 'liberate' all its citizens from Russian 'barbarity' following Moscow's withdrawal and subsequent signs of human rights abuses.

TITLE: Radical climate protesters in Portugal storm building, urge economy minister to resign
SUMMARY: Hundreds of angry climate protesters took to the streets of Lisbon on Saturday, with dozens storming into a building where Portuguese Economy Minister Antonio Costa e Silva was.

TITLE: Underwater earthquake struck near Tonga in southern Pacific
SUMMARY: An underwater earthquake has made itself aware near Tonga in the southern Pacific. Authorities issued, then soon lifted, a tsunami advisory.

TITLE: Iranian man who inspired Tom Hanks' 'The Terminal' dies at Paris airport
SUMMARY: Mehran Karimi Nasseri, an Iranian man whose unusual life inspired films such as Steven Spielberg's “The Terminal,” died at Charles de Gaulle Airport Saturday. He lived there for 18 years.

TITLE: Explosion on Istanbul’s pedestrian avenue; deaths reported
SUMMARY: Fire trucks and police responded to an explosion on a popular pedestrian avenue in Istanbul Sunday afternoon that left people dead and injured, with the cause of the explosion unclear.

TITLE: Istanbul explosion rips through popular street market, killing 6, 81 injured: reports
SUMMARY: An explosion in Istanbul, Turkey killed six people and injured at least 81 after ripping through the popular pedestrian Istiklal Avenue.

TITLE: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy says investigators have 'documented more than 400 Russian war crimes' in Kherson
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Sunday that investigators have found evidence of war crimes in the recently recaptured city of Kherson.

TITLE: Gen Z climate activist: Throwing paint, stopping traffic is privileged protest and unhelpful
SUMMARY: Young eco-activists having defaced paintings and poured onto freeways for environmental justice are not tangibly improving the climate, conservationist says.
